documentType: aircraft purchase agreement and related corporate filings
summary: This document is an Aircraft Purchase Agreement dated April 2021 for the sale of a Sikorsky S-76C++ helicopter (tail number N722JE) from Hyperion Air, LLC to Industrial Integrity Solutions, LLC (also referenced as Previti Brothers Charter Services, LLC). It includes related FAA registration forms, corporate statements, and an International Registry services agreement. The document reveals financial and corporate structures related to the aircraft transaction. This is a California Secretary of State Statement of Information filing for the domestic stock corporation 'Frontier Finance Co.', listing its officers, directors, and agent for service of process. It reveals the corporate structure and key individuals associated with this entity, which is involved in financing and real estate. This document is a collection of forms related to the sale of a Sikorsky S-76C++ helicopter (tail number N722JE) from Hyperion Air, LLC to Industrial Integrity Solutions, LLC in May 2021. It includes a Florida Department of Revenue tax exemption affidavit, a second amendment to the purchase agreement extending the closing date, and a delivery receipt. The documents show the $1.8 million transaction and efforts to avoid Florida sales tax.

persons.role: Member/Manager of LLC, Chief Executive Officer, Director
persons.context: Listed as a member of Industrial Integrity Solutions, LLC and as the Chief Executive Officer and a director of Frontier Finance Co. He is involved in the corporate structure of entities purchasing or associated with the aircraft.

persons.context: Signed as the authorized representative for the purchaser (Industrial Integrity Solutions, LLC) on the Aircraft Purchase Agreement. Also listed as the Secretary and Chief Financial Officer of Frontier Finance Co. and as the CFO/Backup Contact for the International Registry agreement.

persons.name: Eric Roth

persons.name: James L Previti

connections.description: Both are officers/directors of Frontier Finance Co. and are involved in the corporate structure of Industrial Integrity Solutions, LLC, which is purchasing the aircraft.
Munkvold signed as purchaser's representative and Indyke as seller's representative on the Aircraft Purchase Agreement for the helicopter.
The two LLCs are parties to the Aircraft Purchase Agreement for the Sikorsky S-76C++ helicopter.
Previti is listed as a member of Industrial Integrity Solutions, LLC, with Frontier Finance Co. also listed as a member, indicating a corporate ownership structure.
Both serve as officers (CEO and Secretary/CFO, respectively) and directors of Frontier Finance Co.
Michael Montgomery, as counsel, certified the corporate filing on behalf of the corporation where James L Previti is CEO.
Michael Montgomery, as counsel, certified the corporate filing on behalf of the corporation where Richard Munkvold is Secretary/CFO.
Represented the buyer and seller, respectively, in a $1.8 million aircraft purchase transaction.

events.title: Aircraft Purchase Agreement Execution
events.description: Hyperion Air, LLC agrees to sell a 2008 Sikorsky S-76C++ helicopter (N722JE) to Industrial Integrity Solutions, LLC for $1,800,000.

events.title: Helicopter Custom Refurbishment
events.description: The helicopter underwent a stunning new custom refurbishment by Eric Roth's International Jet Interiors.

events.title: Formation of Industrial Integrity Solutions, LLC
events.description: The purchasing LLC, Industrial Integrity Solutions, LLC, was formed in New Mexico.

events.title: International Registry Services Agreement
events.description: Industrial Integrity Solutions, LLC enters into an agreement with AIC Title Service, LLC for International Registry professional administration services related to the aircraft.

events.title: Corporate Filing Submission
events.description: A Statement of Information for Frontier Finance Co. was filed with the California Secretary of State, updating or confirming its corporate details.

events.title: Aircraft Sale Closing
events.description: The closing date for the sale of a Sikorsky S-76C++ helicopter from Hyperion Air, LLC to Industrial Integrity Solutions, LLC, extended from May 7, 2021.

events.title: Aircraft Purchase Agreement Execution
events.description: Execution of the Second Amendment to the Aircraft Purchase Agreement, extending the closing deadline and making an additional $100,000 deposit non-refundable.

events.title: Original Aircraft Purchase Agreement
events.description: The original purchase agreement for the Sikorsky helicopter was entered into between Hyperion Air, LLC and Industrial Integrity Solutions, LLC.

events.title: First Amendment to Purchase Agreement
events.description: The purchase agreement was previously amended for the first time.

locations: Fort Lauderdale Executive Airport KFXE, Florida
keyFacts: A Sikorsky S-76C++ helicopter (tail number N722JE) was sold for $1.8 million in April 2021 from Hyperion Air, LLC to Industrial Integrity Solutions, LLC.
The purchasing entity, Industrial Integrity Solutions, LLC, has members James L. Previti (individual) and Frontier Finance Co. (a California corporation).
The aircraft had undergone a major custom interior refurbishment in 2019 by International Jet Interiors.
The transaction involved an escrow agent (AIC Title Service, LLC) and provisions for International Registry filings under the Cape Town Convention.
Corporate filings show James L. Previti and Rich Munkvold holding key officer positions in Frontier Finance Co., which is involved in the ownership structure.
Frontier Finance Co. (Corporate Number C2557295) is a California corporation involved in 'Financing & Real Estate'.
The corporation's officers are James L Previti (CEO) and Richard Munkvold (Secretary and CFO), who are also its only listed directors.
The agent for service of process for the corporation is Paracorp Incorporated.
The filing was certified by counsel Michael Montgomery on August 27, 2019.
A Sikorsky S-76C++ helicopter (tail number N722JE, serial 760750) was sold for $1,800,000 in May 2021.
The purchaser, Industrial Integrity Solutions, LLC, filed a Florida tax exemption affidavit claiming non-resident status to avoid Florida sales tax.
The closing date for the sale was extended from May 7, 2021, to May 13, 2021, contingent on a non-refundable $200,000 deposit.
The aircraft had 2641.9 hours on the airframe and 5472 landings at the time of delivery.
